oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SB 1766 AMENDED
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: n/a, n/a
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: California animal lovers, aviculturists and zoos havecome under the gun as SB 1766 wound its way, withdifficulty, through the legislative labyrinth of theCalifornia Senate and Assembly. In its initial form SB1766 would have out-right banned all birds, mammals,reptiles and amphibians, except under permit, ongrounds it is contrary to their welfare to be kept in Â captivity; established a state licensing prog~am for allanimals incorporating the permit fee to rmse therevenue'; and would have allowed Fish and Game personnelto enter private premises without warrant toinspect or confiscate any animals found in undesirableconditions.
